relation.text: is expected in England this Month
is not yet brought to bed , the first 10 days
some time -- most probably till Easter
sat with me a long time
yesterday afternoon Mr. Farhill was my Esquire , we attended
go to Eastbourne at 5 o Clock on Monday
11 days -- do not my lovely friend let
enter upon it in Health & spirits -- May
Yours Mary Hamilton East Bourne Suſsex 8 th June 1780
the time of Henry the 6th- till within these 4 Years
was built by Sir Roger Fiennes in 1423
s abt . 14 Miles from hence -- a very fine situation -- the Park is 7 Miles in circumference -- the Ground finely disposed by Nature , and highly improved by 15 years
belongs to Sir George Webster , & it is now
hear they are in ye . stile of his Majesti es at Richmond -- but wth . greater natural advantages . 10 ) March 24
Wednesday sennight -- The rest of ye . Royal Children remain
will ever find me the same . My excellent friends Mr. Smelt , Mrs : Carter , & c Breakfast with me tomorrow
that day , though it was often at my Father 's
s Gardens , Eastbourne Sea Seat Septr . 4 th . 1780
a month ago , you are , perhaps doing yourself great injury . -- I am likewise very much concerned
1780 Eastbourne I am grateful for the scrap you sent
occupied was were in the direct line Adieu the Post waits -- Your true Friend Mary Hamilton 7 th . Septr .. 1780

June 1780 Our journey was very pleasant , the weather fine , the Roads good , & the views beautiful , particularly from East Grinstead to Ukfield , from whence the prospect was more confined but the Fields were covered
the horrid transactions in London . The reconciliation of the King to the Dukes of Gloucester & Cumberland is now
June 1780 The Birth day was celebrated
did not go to Northamptonshire this Summer
had been sometime deeply involved in debt . The Creditors are now
represented yourself to be . Windsor -- Queens Upper Lodge Octbr . 23 d . 1780
will remain at the Queens House in Town till he is 21 . The Duke of Cumberland was here on Sunday
honored me with his prate was his acquaintance with so many of my relations & c Tuesday
is fixed for the Christening -- Monday
loved friend Lady Dartrey is now
the next day from 7 in the Morng till 12 at night I was taken up
Yesterday was the Prince Edward s
s Husband has been dead abt . a Year
shew her moon shine civility . Adieu my Dr . frd . Mary Hamilton Queens Lodge Windsor 25 th Novbr . 1781
some time , are to be from Friday
now in the most deplorable of all situations , -- confined
s Eſ U pshire Farm Eſsex 26 th . Sepbr . 1783
one day night at Courteenhall & I will take
Yesterday the weather was agreeably pleasant & Dr . Ly . Wake endulged
three days extremely ill made me no longer hesitate
1803 -- Mrs. G.Glover under ye . most unpromising exterior poſseſses
is taken from ye . Arabian nights
July 1784 Clarges Street My Dear friend I do not wish
this Summer as I am much interested abt . her both for her own & her late mother s
death as fast as poſsible I am now
find this this very pleasant , Adieu ton chere Amie ! Mry Hamilton ( 35 ) Monday
this Summer -- I will however still hope
Saturday at her Villa at Thames Ditton with Mr : Pepys , we got
tomorrow with Lord & Lady Stormont , if I am not obliged
Wednesday Morning I am to have Sir Wm . Hamilton 's
protect you my dr . frd . Mary Hamilton ( 37 23 d . August 1784
will be in a few days
speak of your family in terms of of gratitude & sincere affection . Mr. Young is now
hope my Dear I may be able in a day or two
Yours Mry Hamilton Enclose to Viscount Stormont Portland place . 20 th - Sepbr- 1804
s at Wandsworth Hill for a week
a few days happily with & Mrs. Walsingham at Thames Ditton . My Uncle William informed
will take me to Town on Thursday
yesterday my Dear in a frank of Lord Stormont s
Winter & she has in ye most friendly manner insisted
1804 may be the date on which the letters were copied
appear among the original letters in No- 15 . A E H Anson “ Southfield ” St Leonards on sea 7 March 1906
misdated 1803 26 “ Septr 26 th 27 27 “ Decr 9 th 28 28 1784 July 1
were written to Miss Charlotte Margaret Gunning , maid of Honour to Queen Charlotte between 24 th March 1780
November 1784 -- she was the daughter of Sir Robert Gunning who was minister plenipotentiary at Berlin He was born
1790 & her Sister Barbara Emily Isabella ( referred
